function.name: SitemapXml
function.description: Returns a hierarchical XML structure of pages. When executed as part of a page rendering XML elements representing the current and ancestor pages will be appended the attributes isopen=”true” and iscurrent=”true”

param.name: SourcePage
param.label: Source page
param.description: By default the source page is the page currently being rendered. Specify a value if you want to get sitemap information relative to another page. The source page controls how page elements are annotated with 'isopen' and 'iscurrent' and is the starting point when calculating the page scope.

param.name: PageAssociationScope
param.label: Page scope
param.description: The scope of pages to extract from the sitemap. The default is 'all pages'. You can use this parameter to extract the structure you need to complete your task.

function.name: GetIPageXml
function.description: Retrieves an XML representation of the data.

param.name: PropertyNames
param.label: Selected fields
param.description: The data fields to output in the XML. Fewer fields can yield faster renderings.

param.name: OrderByField
param.label: Order by
param.description: The field to order data by

param.name: OrderAscending
param.label: Order ascending
param.description: When set to true results are delivered in in ascending order, otherwise descending order is used. Default is ascending order.

param.name: PageSize
param.label: Page size
param.description: The number of items to display on one page – the maximum number of elements to return.

param.name: PageNumber
param.label: Page number
param.description: If the number of data elements exceed the page size you can use paging to move to the other pages. See the Page size parameter.

param.name: ShowReferencesInline
param.label: Show reference data inline
param.description: If you include reference data in the 'Selected properties' setting, you can use this option to control how the referenced data is included. 'Inline' is easy to use, but may bloat the size of the XML document.

param.name: IncludePagingInfo
param.label: Include paging info
param.description: When selected the data XML will be preceded by a <PagingInfo /> element detailing number of pages, items and more.

param.name: Randomized
param.label: Randomized
param.description: When true data can be ordered randomly. Specify the number of random results you require by setting the 'Page size'. If a filter is specified, this is applied before the random selection. If you speficy an 'Order by' value, you should specify a low 'Page size' or the randomization will become void.

param.name: ElementName
param.label: Element name
param.description: The name of the XML element. The detault is 'IPage'

param.name: ElementNamespace
param.label: Element namespace
param.description: The namespace the XML element belongs to. The detault is ''

function.name: CompoundFilter
function.description: Defines an “and” or “or” query, combining two other filters.

param.name: IsAndQuery
param.label: And / or filter
param.description: If you select “And” both filters are applied to the data. Selecting “Or” will give you the data that matches just one of the filters.

param.name: Left
param.label: Left filter
param.description: One of the two filters (the one to evaluate first)

param.name: Right
param.label: Right filter
param.description: One of the two filters (the one to evaluate last)

function.name: FieldPredicatesFilter
function.description: Lets you specify a filter on data by specifying requirements for the individual fields. If you set requirements on multiple fields, they are all enforced (and query).

param.name: Id
param.label: Id filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: TemplateId
param.label: TemplateId filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: Title
param.label: Title filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: MenuTitle
param.label: MenuTitle filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: UrlTitle
param.label: UrlTitle filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: FriendlyUrl
param.label: FriendlyUrl filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: Abstract
param.label: Abstract filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: ChangeDate
param.label: ChangeDate filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: ChangedBy
param.label: ChangedBy filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: PublicationStatus
param.label: PublicationStatus filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: CultureName
param.label: CultureName filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

param.name: SourceCultureName
param.label: SourceCultureName filter
param.description: Specify a criteria that this field must meet or use the default value (no criteria)

function.name: DateTimeGreaterThan
function.description: Check if a date is greater than a certain value

function.name: DataReferenceFilter
function.description: Converts a DataReference into a single element filter. This filter will select a maximum of one item.

param.name: DataReference
param.label: Data Reference
param.description: The Data Reference to use when selecting data.

function.name: GetInputParameter
function.description: Returns an input parameter from executing function context. Use this in developing to copy an input value to a new function call.

param.name: InputParameterName
param.label: Parameter name
param.description: Specify the name of the input parameter which value you wish to use here.
